content:
Diagnosis:
Follicular thyroid carcinoma, Stage II (pT2N0M0)

Treatment History:
Total thyroidectomy - 15 January 2024
Radioactive iodine ablation 3.7GBq - 12 March 2024

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Current medications:
Levothyroxine 150mcg daily
Metformin 1g bd
Ramipril 5mg od

Current situation:
Post-treatment review following RAI ablation

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of radioactive iodine ablation treatment. She has recovered well from the procedure with no significant side effects. Mild temporary taste disturbance has now completely resolved. She reports good energy levels on current thyroid replacement dose.

Thyroglobulin level is appropriately suppressed at <0.1 ng/ml. TSH remains well controlled at 0.05 mU/L indicating adequate suppression. Neck examination shows well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no concerning features.

Post-ablation scan shows no evidence of residual thyroid tissue or metastatic disease. The treatment has been successful with good uptake in thyroid bed.

Plan:
Continue current levothyroxine dose
Repeat thyroglobulin and TSH in 3 months
Surveillance neck ultrasound in 6 months
Follow up appointment in 3 months with blood results

cancer_timeline.value: Thyroglobulin appropriately suppressed at <0.1 ng/ml, TSH well controlled at 0.05 mU/L
Post-ablation scan shows no evidence of residual thyroid tissue or metastatic disease

patient_facts.value: Well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no concerning features

status_updates.value: Stage II follicular thyroid carcinoma treated with total thyroidectomy and radioactive iodine ablation. Good response to treatment with appropriate suppression of disease markers
Good uptake in thyroid bed on post-ablation scan with no evidence of residual disease
Mild temporary taste disturbance now completely resolved
Repeat thyroglobulin and TSH in 3 months, surveillance neck ultrasound in 6 months
Follow up appointment in 3 months with blood results
